Reviews.Title: “Very good for what it was”
Reviews.Author: WelshTraveller4
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Viking Hotel for one night whilst going to a concert at the O2 Arena, it was the cheapest option and I wasn't expecting much, however, the hotel was surprisingly nice! All the public areas were nicely and grandly done, the staff were friendly, the bathrooms were all modern and the facilities in the room were great. The bedroom was spacious with a flat screen TV too. The only comment I would make is that the cleanliness could be better. The breakfast was basic but it's all you need, cereal, toast, cold meat, cheese, yoghurts, teas, coffees and fresh juice. It is just 15 mins walk away from the tube or there is a bus stop right outside - Atherton Lesuire Centre stop. Which is just a couple of stops from the tube. Very convinient location.

Reviews.Title: “Clean And Comfy For An Excellent Price”
Reviews.Author: DaveWMiltonKeynes
Reviews.Content: Lets face it if you want a 5* hotel in London you are going to have to pay big money. Even a 2*can burn a hole in your pocket but this was an exception to the rule 2 nights for £100 I was a bit wary but then again all we really wanted was somewhere to rest our heads and clean ourselves up. For the 2* hotel I have to say we were quite surprised how nice things were. We arrived at 11am and were able to check in straight away which is always a good start. We had a room on the 1st floor which was right next to the lift the view of the room was of a leisure centre that was originally a bath house and it still has parts of its original outer. The room was more than adequate with a large sized bathroom with an over bath shower, basin and WC, there was a good size double bed and there was adequate storage (Wardrobe, cupboard and draws). The room had a wall mounted flat screen TV (with Freeview), this had no remote however but was still workable. The room also had a hairdryer and a kettle. They were a bit stingy on the tea and coffee left, however reception were more than happy to give you more if you asked. The only complaint with the room was being front facing you could hard traffic noise but after a while you tend not to notice. The room was cleaned daily to a high standard. The breakfast wasn’t brilliant but was adequate enough. It was continental with a choice of a couple of cereals, toast, ham, chicken, cheese and yogurts with tea, coffee and orange juice to drink you could have as much as you wished. It was a bit of a shame that it was only server till 9:00 when you are away on a chilling out weekend sometimes its nice to be able to sleep in a bit. If you miss breakfast or desire a full English there are plenty of cafes and bars between the hotel and reaching the main shopping centre. The staff were very friendly and spoke good English even though it was obvious that it wasn’t their first language for most of them. What I think the hotel lacks is a bar, there was a huge lobby and a 24 hour reception that was often quiet, I feel that they could operate a bar here and it be quite successful. For a drink to bring back however there is a Sainsbury’s local and Tesco express in less than a 2 min walk. The hotel had adequate parking, however going away for the weekend the last thing I want to do is drive so public transport is my choice. For public transport the hotel is ¾ of a mile from Stratford (central line, DLR and mainline) station and ½ a mile to Maryland mainline station. It is a flat walk past mainly shops in a well lit open area so seems as safe as anywhere. There was also a bus stop outside the hotel with 2 bus routes that would take you to the college in 3 mins for Maryland or the main shopping centre in 5 mins for Stratford. You can also stay on the bus to Bow road in about 10 mins and catch a district or Hammersmith and city tube if you are going elsewhere. We never waited more than 5 mins for a bus either way. If you buy a travel card you can use the busses, trains and tubes as often as you like in a day and Subject to any disasters you can easily be in central London in 20-30 minutes. If you are intend on using a travel card the next day, one tip I would give you is to buy the travel card the day before at a station as you cannot purchase these on the bus and its likely you may want to take a bus to a station as your first call from the hotel. On checkout the staff are perfectly happy to store your baggage so you can enjoy your day before you head off home. Stratford itself had a large shopping centre (next to the tube station) with supermarkets and your usual high street shops, this is next to the tube station and the building remains open 24 hours. The outside is being done up for the Olympics so looks a bit like a building site but inside is fine. Outside the shopping centre you seem to get different people screaming about different religions. They can seem quite intimidating and nasty but if you just walk on by they do not approach you. The Olympic park is also next door to the tube station which is worth just having a look at even from a distance. This has advantage Stratford with the area being cleaned up and the station being modernised and many other improvements made. I would have no issues with staying at this hotel again in the future especially if they keep their prices reasonable, I’m sure they will rocket during the Olympics but outside that period hopefully not.

Reviews.Title: “A decent budget option”
Reviews.Author: tripaddvisor
Reviews.Content: Considering the price, there wasn't really much to fault with our stay at the Viking Hotel. As others have said, it was a motel-style arrangement. Rooms were fine, clean, as was bathroom with a decent shower. And unusual to be in London and able to park for free on site. Breakfast was basic, but adequate we thought for an overnight stay. Staff were pleasant and friendly. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and modern”
Reviews.Author: Burnstyles
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my misses for new years in London. Pros: Hotel is easy to find. 15 min walk to tube. Near many supermarkets. Hotel was clean and modern. Was like a motel style hotel. Great shower. Good ventilation and heating. Great price. Cons: Took around 15 mins to check in as there was a mix up using onhotels.com they did not send a copy of the booking to the hotel, so after looking and re-looking at all his bookings I showed the guy on reception my booking reference and he invited me behind the desk to print it off his computer. Although it was a mix up and he was very apologetic it did take a while to sort out. Our room did not have any net curtians compared to others around us, so had to have curtains closed. Toilet plumbing had a prolonged dripping once used. Have to get a zone 4 travelcard. Did not have breakfast as did not get up in time but breakfast room was huge. Would stay here again was a bit out of London but easy to get into the center and a great price for what your getting.

Reviews.Title: “Might be good value, but you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: RobFordham
Reviews.Content: Decent location if you need to be close to Westfields shopping centre but wouldn't recommend this place to a friend. I'm a fairly typical 25 year old guy and I don't think I've ever complained somewhere about cleanliness but this place needed some attention. It was pretty clear the place hadn't been cleaned in a while, dirty sink and toothbrush holder and even a used plaster in our drawers. Now that kind of thing might be one-off so I wouldn't let it put people off but even the bedsheets didn't smell clean and made us pretty keen to leave the very next morning. My advice; if like me you need a hotel on a budget, maybe consider going a little further out of town to a chain you can half-trust. Breakfast equally poor with slices of cheese and ham, stale bread and 10p yoghurt's. On the plus side, it did allow us free parking for the day which in central London is never a guarantee. I won't go here again - I wouldn't advise anyone else to either unless they've no alternative.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Money. We would stay again”
Reviews.Author: MET1161
Reviews.Content: All Adults, Family week-end visit to celebrate our Daughter's Birthday so needed an overnight stay close to where she lives. The best things about the Hotel: Excellent Value for Money: £80.00 for a room x 3 Adults x 1 night. We were given a ground floor room which appeared to be brand new; Very Clean Room which was also spacious and warm; Comfortable Beds with sufficient decent pillows; Excellent ensuite with a great shower and towels included; More than enough wardrobe (with hangers) and drawer space; FreeView TV; Tea and Coffee provided. Free on site car parking. Disappointing and Quite Poor aspects of our stay: Reception staff did not inform us as to the start and end time of breakfast (07:15 - 09:00) so, even though continental breakfast was included in the price, we did not benefit as we turned up in the Dining area just at 09:05. Breakfast was completely cleared away. We felt this was a particularly early time for breakfast to end especially on a Sunday, which it was. When approached to ask about breakfast, Staff in the Dining area were disinterested and unhelpful - quite abrupt, verging on rudeness and staff in reception area just shrugged their collective shoulders, without a hint of an apology when it was pointed out that they had not advised us of breakfast timings when we'd booked in the previous day. Booking confirmation paperwork does not give info about breakfast start and end times. The part of the hotel we stayed in - old Villa type property (next door to Reception area) which has been refurbished was Noisy as Hotel appears to attract a young (17+ years of age) clientele. Hotel Location was ok but DLR is approx 20 minutes walk away. However, Hotel is on a main road giving access to regular buses. We returned to the Hotel late at night, walking from the DLR. Stratford appeared and felt quite safe, as safe as other places (Poplar, Bow, Catford) we've stayed in and walked through late at night. We would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable - For The Wrong Reasons”
Reviews.Author: graham1410
Reviews.Content: This hotel is reasonably quiet with nearly all the rooms well off the main road. Tea and coffee are provided in the rooms and the en suite is adequate but the single pillow resembled granite. However, it is the breakfast that is truly memorable and redefines the word 'Continental'. You'll come down to the vilest coffee you ever tasted and sadly, there is little to repair your damaged taste buds. Why not start with the vast array of cereals - corn flakes or rice krispies? Follow it up with the indifferent 3 for a pound yogurts. Round off your breakfast experience with the cheapest and least appetising white bread money can buy, together with the meanest choice of accompaniments you'll ever clap eyes on - apricot jam, processed cheese and processed meat (one type only). This was the worst breakfast I've ever had anywhere and I cringed at the thought of what all the foreign guests must be left thinking of British cuisine.

Reviews.Title: “Not central, but ideal”
Reviews.Author: Lingo72
Reviews.Content: Used this hotel as a base for 3 days after spending a night in Golders Green. Rooms were clean with usual tea/coffee etc, and they were cleaned daily and towels replaced. Freeview TV in the room, adequate space and even had hangers in the wardrobe (even if they were a mixture of all sorts!). Bathroom was clean and shower was OK although seemed to lose a bit of water pressure occasionally. Didn't eat there as we were out round town but service was good, even though reception is a little odd with a security grill pulled down most of the time. However, it is located in Stratford which is understandable, a place you don't add to the tourist itinerary (and the Olympics are really going to be here!!!!). Before they built the new Westfield shopping centre which has just opened you could get the bus straight to Stratford station to jump on the central line or DLR into town. This isn't the case now. Best option is probably to get the 25 bus to Mile End tube or take it all the way into town (Oxford Circus or Holborn terminii). However, the traffic congestion that can occur at the roundabout in Stratford means you could well be on the 25 for an hour and a half when the tube takes 20 mins. Either way the bus stop is 40 yards down the road and the 25's run regularly day and night so getting back to the hotel is no problem. Best option for eating out locally would be the Goose or the Goldengrove (Weatherspoons). Cheap and a bit of east end character due to some of the patrons!

Reviews.Title: “Bland breakfast but brilliant bed...”
Reviews.Author: sharpydotcom Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: I have recently had occasion to stay at the viking hotel, and let me tell you I was (for the most part) pleased. I have stayed at several hotels in the east end of London (Old Kent Road was always cheaper than Mayfair...) and some of them have been shocking. I am please to say, this was not the case with the Viking. I tend to choose the Stratford/Romford area as it is close to a transport hub, I think further out of city centre is too risky for getting home at night. The viking is a bit further from said hub than I am used to, but given that I tend to use Oyster cards for travel, getting a bus reduced that issue somewhat. The hotel itself is actually very nice, each guest having an ensuite room in a dedicated living unit. It is not like many hotels, crowbarred into whatever space was available. The staff were friendly, and when I discovered my door key did not work, they immediately without issue, swapped my room. My only complaint, and believe me - compared to all of the above, its minor, the breakfast was a bit bland. That being said, the Viking actually has an adequate dining facility to house a lot of guests, unlike many other hotels in the east in that serve breakfasts in whatever cupboard is available (See earlier crowbar remark) A well deserved 4

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, very clean”
Reviews.Author: jeremy_inc Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed here just for one night, was good, reception staff were a little dismissive however. Seemed like we were bothering them. Didn't have the breakfast so couldn't comment on that. Room was clean and provided with the normal things you would expect, kettle, TV, tea/coffee etc. Overall good value

Reviews.Title: “Essential, cheap but far”
Reviews.Author: MicroBTS
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night in this hotel when in London for a football game. As we were on a tight budget I choosed this hotel as it had good reviews compared to others in this price category. The hotel is longer way from the city center than it seemed on a map. As we used the hotel only for sleeping and not as a base for sightseeing it was OK. Check in without problems. Rooms and furniture seems to be older, but room and also bathroom were clean, although the equipment seemend a bit worn. The surroundings area did not seem dangerous and a shopping centre is 15 minutes walk (or a short ride by the bus). Breakfast were simple but I did manage. Checkout quick and again without problems. Overall for those on tight budget this hotel is OK.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but bad location”
Reviews.Author: peter2000ny
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located about 10-15 minutes walk from the Stradtford Tube Station and a couple of minutes by the bus the 86 and 25 which stop in front of the hotel (if you buy a travel card or Oyster card you have unlimited bus and tube rides). There is a Shopping Mall in front of the Stradtford Station where you can find supermarkets, clothes stores and fast food chains like McDonald’s, Starbucks, KFC and Pizza Hut. There are two supermarkets very close to the hotel where you can buy fruits or drinks. The room was clean and there is an instant coffee and tea maker in the room. The breakfast was very basic. The receptionists were very friendly and willing to help and last day we left the luggage in the front desk while we went to downtown because the check out was at 10:30. Cons: The hotel doesn’t offer Wi-Fi and is a bit away from the center. Pros: Good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, good and excellent rooms”
Reviews.Author: NickSFCB
Reviews.Content: I stopped here recently for the weekend of the Champions League Final. The hotel itself was brilliant for a low budget. The only problem we encountered was 1) the poor service of the receptionist and 2) the lack of English spoke by the recepitionist. The rooms were large, comfortable, and had an en-suite aswell as a television and coffee facilities. Breakfast was available but it finished at 09.30. The hotel is within walkign distance of Stratford Station. So is easy to commute. The area it is in, isnt all that. And we experienced a few minor problems with the local migrants, who seemed to lack any respect and took it upon themselves to cause trouble. This obviously is not a problem of the hotel, but could be off putting. I will be retuning for the Olympic games in 2012. It also offers free parkign which is a great help

Reviews.Title: “Bare Essentials: Bathroom/Bed/Cleanliness/Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: bictinwin
Reviews.Content: The staff were very friendly and helpful. Note that your key must be dropped off at the front desk each time you venture out into the city and then picked up when you return. We found this useful as we did not have to keep up with our key during our outings. They were also very attentive with our requests making sure we had extra pillows when we requested it. The cleaning staff cleaned the room everyday. It was nice not to share a bathroom and have our own bathroom even though it was really small. Be aware if you have claustrophobia. Shower, toilet, and sink are like the size of a closet. Water was hot but low pressure at times. Breakfast was served every morning, which consisted of cereal, milk, coffee (instant), OJ (watered-down or powder?), deli meats, toast, jam, and warm yogurt. Con: It was about a 15-20 minute walk to the nearest Metro station, which is Stratford. This may not seem bad but when you're returning home from a long day out, it is quite tiring. Also there is no A/C so I would not book during the hot summer months. For us, it was fine since the weather was cool and we were fine with just the windows open and the room fan on. Also the hotel did not have or offer wireless. Phone calls, even local, had to be done in the lobby. Also, it was about a 25-30 minute ride to central London, where most of the main attractions are. so like I mentioned above, if you're looking for a hotel to just crash in at the end of the day with a place to shower and has the bare essentials then this is a decent place.

Reviews.Title: “clean, cheap and not bad location”
Reviews.Author: Wiolka_111
Reviews.Content: Hotel is nice and comfortable. We stayed 5 nights in March 2011. Bathroom and room was clean. Basic breakfast, but quite good: bread, ham, cheese, butter, jam, yoghurts, milk, cornflakes, juice, tea, coffee. Neighborhood at first look, seems to be risky, but we didn't have any problems. Not bad location. Only 45 minutes to Stansted Airport by coach (8 £, every 30 min.) from Stradford station. Hotel is not far from underground Stratford station (it takes 10-15 minutes to walk to the station, the fastest way is through the shopping center -open 24 hours a day, you could also take a bus in front of the hotel, 25 - has a stop opposite the shopping center and then you have to walk through the center, 86 -has a stop in front of the underground station). Niezły hotel jak na tą cenę, całkiem czysto, codzienne sprzątanie pokoi. Śniadanie w formie bufetu (chleb, wędliny, ser, masło, dżem, jogurty, mleko, płatki, soki, herbata, kawa). W pokoju też można zrobić sobie herbatę czy kawę. Okolica na pierwszy rzut oka niebezpieczna, ale okazało się ze nie było żadnych problemów. Lokalizacja niezła. na lotnisko Stansted jeżdżą autobusy ze stacji Stratford, dokładnie przed wejściem do metra jest stacja autobusów miejskich , trochę obok stanowisko dalekobieżnych czyli na lotnisko (koszt 8 £, co około 30 min.) Do stacji metra z hotelu 10-15 min piechotą, (najszybciej trzeba przejść przez centrum handlowe, otwarte przejście całą dobę), można też autobusem sprzed hotelu, 25 -ma przystanek przed centrum handlowym i potem tym przejściem, 86- przystanek przed samym wejściem do metra).

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: ladieshoes
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a relatively inexpensive place to stay in London this is the hotel of choice. Not sure how safe neighborhood is. When you enter the hotel lobby there is a security gate between you and the receptionist. The room was dirty, smelt like cigarettes. This location is far from the center of London. The 12 minutes walk from hotel to tube requires walking through local neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Fitz077
Reviews.Content: Myself and two friends stayed at the Viking Hotel in a Triple room as we were visiting the O2. The staff were very friendly, the room was of a good size and very clean. I would recommend this hotel and would stay here again when going to the O2. It is only a 10 minute walk from the tube station, but is well serviced by two buses. There is a Sainsburys and a Tesco local within a minutes walk from the hotel.:)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent !”
Reviews.Author: Iubita
Reviews.Content: I like a lot to stay at this hotel. Everything was perfect. The water is hot, in the room is warm, the staff are very very friendly, ( I remember in a night, when a come back late, I asked the man from the reception where can I buy bread at that hour, he told me that everything was close because it’ s so late, and after he gave me his pizza, he told me that he ate, and it’s enough for him. I’m impressed because after I go up in the room, the pizza was untouched, so he don’t’ ate, like as said ) It’s a little far from the center, but it’s ok, because with metro in 30 minutes you will be to the Oxford station. You can take the 86 or 25 bus, and in 10 minutes you will be in front of the underground station. The Central Line tube goes to Stratford. The bed was perfect, the room was clean, they maids cleaned it every day, when we were out, so.. never disturbed by them. The breakfast was basic, but it’ s ok, ham butter, bread, juice, milk, tea…cheese. I'll certainly coming back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It was good enough for us: clean and you get all the basic stuff”
Reviews.Author: aviva_witch
Reviews.Content: As most people already said, this hotel is far from center, but you have two buses driving just infront of hotel, so it was good enough for us. We bought an Oyster weekly bus card, so we could drive around as much as we wanted. The rooms are basic, we had very small triple room, tho, it was good enough for us. We did see bigger rooms (double, triple) so I think not all the rooms are that small. We could make tea or coffie, you get a water boiller in the room, so that was good, too. We got clean towels and soap and toilet paper every day... Breakfast was the same every day, basic stuff like marmelade, cornflakes, toast, cheese and ham... but honestly I am used to that, it's not a 5 star hotel and for the price we paid I think it was just fine. We spent there 7 nights and we have no complains. Except the price of internet is just too much, one pound for 10 min. Our teenager spent quite a few pounds there:) The staff was friendly, too. We liked staying there and this hotel is located perfectly for Olimpic games in 2012. :)

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but too far from center”
Reviews.Author: lilizav
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Viking for 2 nights in June. Hotel is quiet good for 3*, clean and freandly but rooms are very small, breakfast is acceptable . The worst thing - it is location, you will need a bus+ underground or only bus but your journey will take 1 h, also Est London not such nice as West.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location, bad breakfast”
Reviews.Author: RamonaCuciuch
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice and clean. Our room (3 person) was big enough and had a view towards the street. Rooms were very well equipped. I didn't like the breakfast. It was basic, it's true, but even the most basic stuff was the cheeapest on the market...

Reviews.Title: “Very clean basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: doodko
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Viking hotel (a part of it looks like a motel actually) for a couple of nights. I could recommend the hotel to all who don't need anything else but a clean room to take a hot shower and to spend the night :) The hotel prices in london are ridiculous, so 60 pounds per night is a fair rate (including the simple breakfast). Strange thing is that there aren't blankets in the room so we used the bed covers. Plenty of small shops in the area which is not the best one in London but is OK. Staff was OK but not very competent and polite. In one word - budget hotel, good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, clean, convenient”
Reviews.Author: PapaEchoTangoEcho
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here for one night. The manager and staff were helpful and polite, the room was clean and the free secure parking was a boon. The shower in our bathroom was powerful and clean, though we didn't get a bathmat. Breakfast was basic but sustaining. You can take the 86 or 25 bus to the Underground station. It take around 45 minutes in total to get from the hotel to Westminster, say. The only downside was that the room we had was facing the street, and wasn't very well noise insulated - traffic was quite loud during the night. The only downsides were the

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Marmite20
Reviews.Content: Value: I booked my stay via TravelRepublic for around £23 per night, which was amazingly good value; and was even cheaper than a few of the youth hostels in the city centre. I think the standard price for rooms per night is around £60, which isn't bad for London Prices. Location: The hotel itself is a 10-15 minute walk to Stratford Underground station, which provides easy access into central London via the Central or Jubilee lines. Nearby, are various shops, takeaways, two supermarkets, a few cheap to mid-range restaurants and a cinema complex. The immediate area surrounding the hotel never got too loud; for the three nights we stayed there, I managed to sleep well and felt safe throughout. The rooms: The rooms were small but cosy. The bathroom was narrow but long, and the shower was fantastic, I never wanted to get out! I was impressed by the cleanliness of the rooms, the maids cleaned it every day, usually only when we were out, so we were never woken up or disturbed by them. The bed was reasonably comfy, although an additional pillow would have been nice. The tea and coffee making facilities were good, and were replenished daily. The electricity in each room is switched on via a card which is attached to the room key. All of the facilities were operational except for the fan, which would have been useful during the warmer evenings. Breakfast: The breakfast was rather basic, and consisted of watered down orange juice, water, tea, coffee a choice of two cereals (rice crispies and corn flakes), slices of bread (which could be toasted) and slices of cheap cooked meats and cheese. For the price we paid, it wasn't that bad, but after staying in similarly priced hotels in France and Germany, the choice and quality could be improved. In summary, the hotel was good value for money, and I'd definitely recommend it for anyone looking for a basic and modern hotel away (but not too far from) the hustle and bustle of central London.

Reviews.Title: “Good price, bad service and location”
Reviews.Author: chamdo
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for the price and proximity to London. It's in a suburb called Stratford, which is good for finding cheap local food and supermarkets, but it takes a while to get into the city if you're there to see the sights. It's a 15-20 minute walk to the Stratford tube stop, in zone 3 of the tube network, and from there it takes 25-40 minutes to get into the center, depending partially on whether service on any of the lines was interrupted (which seemed to happen pretty often). Also, be aware that over half the rooms are motel-style, and they're currently doing renovations, so if you end up with an outside room you're likely to be woken at 7 or 8 am every morning like we were. The rooms were clean and comfortable, but small; the bathroom was tiny (the door nearly hit the sink when it was opened). Breakfast isn't bad; typical continental European - cereals, milk, tea, coffee, bread, meats and cheeses. The man who seemed to be the manager was awful. The first morning at breakfast, he yelled at one of the maids and threatened to fire her. They were in the kitchen, but both clearly visible to me and just a few feet away, since I was getting cereal at the time. He definitely knew I was there. The following days showed that was characteristic of how he treats his staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good room, breakfast a joke”
Reviews.Author: andyrag
Reviews.Content: This hotel is good value for money, but the fact that breakfast is included is neither here nor there and they shouldn't use it as a selling point. Watered down orange juice, cheap bread, awful looking processed cold meats and cheese and cheap coffee. True, you could eat as much as you want, but would anyone want to?!! The room was OK - very nice bathroom although only cheap bars of soap provided. Decent furnishings with enough space to do work on a laptop.

Reviews.Title: “Best value for fair price”
Reviews.Author: Bearex
Reviews.Content: I can just say that we were suprised by overall service in Viking hotel. We immidiatelly noticed that hotel was recentlly refurbished, and that was very clean. Room was very nice and bathroom very clean. The only remark goes to bed which is litlle narrower as we are used to, but I can also say, that we are litlle spoiled by our king size bed at home. Breakfast was nice, nothing special, but you could eat as much as you like. So if somebody wants to go to London and sleep in hotel for fair price - I recomend Viking hotel.

HotelInfo.Name: Viking Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 162 Romford Road, London E15 4LD, England
